ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Grammar skills and practice to have basic conversational Spanish.
I improved both my Spanish grammar and my Spanish vocabulary. I improved my ability to maintain conversations in Spanish.
I refined my Spanish speaking skills, especially through natural conversational learning.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course under Prof Lpez is really, really fantastic, my favorite Spanish class that I've taken here. The class community built was very strong, so it actually felt like an environment where students wanted to talk. The discussions and projects were also great and creative there weren't any in-class assessments.

The strengths of this course are group projects, speaking opportunities, and conversations in Spanish with classmates. One weakness of the course is the limited time spent on grammar instruction in class. The course could be improved by spending more time on grammar instruction and practice in class.

I think the Canvas was a bit confusing to navigate at times, but I loved the classroom environment the instructor created. Each class was supportive, engaging, and interesting. I loved the class structure around major themes about culture, art, and politics instead of rote memorization.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would absolutely recommend this course.
Yes! I reccommend any Spanish course with Mayte.

Yes. Professor Lpez is a great professor, and she works hard to get to know every student. I enjoyed interacting with Professor Lpez and the other students. I became close with some of the other students.
Yes. This class improves Spanish speaking skills gradually and in a low-stress environment.
